title: In most anticipated series at Fenway in years, Red Sox faceplant against Yankees in opener
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox lost to Yankees 4-1, managing only two hits during the game at Fenway Park.
Lucas Giolito pitched 5.2 innings, allowing two runs, while the Red Sox committed three errors.
The sellout crowd at Fenway Park saw Boston go 0-for-8 with runners in scoring position.

title: Former Patriots DE Deatrich Wise Jr. suffers season-ending injury
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Deatrich Wise Jr. suffered a season-ending left quad injury during a game against the Packers.
Wise was injured while trying to block an extra point and will require surgery.
The 31-year-old signed a one-year, $3.25 million contract with the Commanders in March.

title: When will Connelly Early pitch next for Red Sox? Alex Cora explains
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Connelly Early may start against the Athletics next week, pending a decision on Sunday by Alex Cora.
Early impressed with 11 strikeouts in his MLB debut, tying a Red Sox record for most debut strikeouts.
Alex Cora is considering rotation options involving young pitchers like Payton Tolle and Kyle Harrison.

title: Scott Boras says he, Alex Bregman are ‘waiting until the offseason’ before making opt-out decision
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Alex Bregman and agent Scott Boras will decide on his contract opt-out with the Red Sox after the 2025 season.
Bregman, 31, signed a three-year, $120 million deal with an opt-out option after 2025 and 2026.
Bregman's agent cited his enjoyment in Boston and team potential as factors in considering free agency options.

title: 5 must-watch movies & TV shows streaming right now
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: 'Only Murders in the Building' Season 5 is now streaming on Hulu, featuring villains played by Christoph Waltz, Renée Zellweger, and Logan Lerman.
'Misery', a Stephen King adaptation starring Kathy Bates, is available on HBO Max as part of the September 2025 streaming lineup.
'The Girlfriend', a psychological thriller starring Robin Wright and Olivia Cooke, is currently streaming on Prime Video.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez, Keion White ruled out vs. Dolphins
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Christian Gonzalez and Keion White were ruled out for Sunday's game against the Dolphins, affecting Patriots' defense.
Gonzalez has been out since July with a hamstring injury, while White missed practice due to an illness.
Linebacker Marte Mapu and offensive tackle Morgan Moses are questionable for the Patriots' upcoming game in Miami.

title: With DC Terrell Williams out, who will be calling defensive plays for Patriots vs. Dolphins?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Zak Kuhr, inside linebackers coach, will call defensive plays for the Patriots against the Dolphins on Sunday.
Terrell Williams is away due to an undisclosed health issue unrelated to his previous offseason health scare.
Kuhr previously gained experience as a defensive playcaller during spring practices in Williams' absence.

title: Boston activist Monica Cannon-Grant to plead guilty in federal fraud case
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Monica Cannon-Grant plans to plead guilty in a federal fraud case, originally set for trial on October 14.
Prosecutors claim Cannon-Grant and her late husband defrauded nonprofit donors, spending funds on personal expenses.
The couple faced a 27-count indictment, including wire and mail fraud, conspiracy, and tax violations.

title: Here’s what we know about Tyler Robinson, Charlie Kirk’s alleged assassin
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Tyler James Robinson, 22, a student from Washington, Utah, was arrested for the shooting of Charlie Kirk at Utah Valley University.
Robinson, held without bail, faces charges of aggravated murder, firearm discharge causing harm, and obstruction of justice.
Family reports indicate Robinson became more political recently; ammunition at the scene referenced meme culture and fascism.

title: 7 things to know about a pivotal Red Sox-Yankees series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Red Sox and Yankees are competing for the top AL wild-card spot, with both teams still in the division race.
Boston leads the season series 8-2 against New York and has its top starters pitching this weekend: Giolito, Bello, and Crochet.
The Yankees rely heavily on home runs for success, leading MLB with 249 homers this season and struggling with a .239 average since August.
